data.message: Adds like these, always wonder how it would be received if it was a girl being gawped at

replies.message: I am open to seeing this come into fruition
So you mean literally every advert ever
You raise a fair point.
Joshua beat me to it.
Joshua Phillips needs to learn the definition of the word literally
Paul Fallon Definitions been changed. It can now also mean figuratively.
Well that is literally the stupidest decision ever, they've effectively made the word redundant. I give up on English and will now only be communicating through memes.

Sadly true... However semantics aside, the point still stands. Women are in positions of power in an awful lot of adverts. While men are reduced to bumbling fools. We are yet to strike a balance between males and females. Let alone gay and straight.
It is ALWAYS a woman being objectified. That is entirely the joke behind these Coke ads. Omg lol

This was about sexual objectification. But if you really want to complain that for the first period since forever in this country women are being represented as smart, strong and capable then I'm sure I'll whip out my violin 🎻
Prefer Sprite anyway
Have you not seen the Lynx effect?
Good grief... Sounds like we both need violins
There is a yoghurt advert in the UK with half naked men literally bowing down before this woman and worshiping her, can't imagine the up roar if that ad was reversed.
Sophie Aldus The Lynx effect is still a guy being objectived - it's just that we appreciate the attention.

Fair comment. As a bloke in his 40's a lot of adverts and in indeed  films up until the early 80's always portrayed women as a weak and a bit thick. That wasn't right and things have changed. Now most are treat men the same. Any Boots ad for a start off.
Paul, no one makes the decision to change a definition of a word. Words are created and changed by how and how often we use them in society; language isn't static.
He wont stay like that for long drinking that sugary rubbish ..If you look at people who drink it all the time they tend to be a different shape

Paul Ritchens i dont know about that- i drink waaay too much coca cola and yet im loosing weight somehow.

also- its not about 'oh objectifying women happens'
of course it still happens in ads- but its hypocritical to say one thing is bad and the other is good becuase YOU like the hot guy.
Difference is men don't gaf if women do or not, they care about the hypocrisy.
OBJECTIFYING WOMEN IS WRONG. But its fine to gawp at a dude with his shirt open.
Paul Ritchens, ain't necessarily so, I drink fat coke, hubby is moaning I need to put weight on, so shove your stereotypes where you can stick coke zero and diet coke. :)
I still think there wasn't enough diversity in this advert.
Scott Jones hahaha top subtle troll
Gerry it is Never that way round. Always the man, 100% of the time.
